definitions.definition: unable to pay what you owe, and having had control of your financial matters given, by a law court, to a person who sells your property to pay your debts:
examples: He went bankrupt after only a year in business.
I'll go bankrupt if you kids keep asking me for money!
He believes that modern society is morally bankrupt.

definitions.definition: to cause someone to become bankrupt:
examples: They feared that the loss would bankrupt them.
